Text:
Wow, Thanks for this upload. I actually have the whole set but it's great as a backup.

However, next time could you rip CDs as ordinary FLAC instead of APE. APE is a pain in the behind as I don't burn onto CD but play it directly from my hard drive and the only thing on Windows that plays APE is MPC, and MPC is not really a music player but more for Home Cinema. With normal FLAC I can play back on anything.

Anyway, Cheers and Thanks again.

@scoobydoo2u2
use foobar2000 or songbird 1.2.0 to play ape

Took me 10 minutes to figure how to convert it to FLAC installing couple codecs to my dBpoweramp converter then using batch converter converted all tracks, Until this point I never knew APE codec and still non wiser why it was chosen,

FACTS ABOUT APE (Monkey's Audio):

* Better compression than FLAC
* Plays with Winamp and many other players
* Older and more mature than FLAC

Those who gripe should learn, first!

http://www.monkeysaudio.com/
Foobar2000 don't work...Monkey's Audio won't work...help???

I use Songbird and it plays ape with no problems. 
Thanks a lot for the great upload
I wonder though, why do you have to put all the movements into one single file? I've noticed that a lot of people are doing this. I'm I missing something here?
It plays with VLC, great. Thanks!
